duties_responsibilities.duty: Interfaces with Service Centers and operators to assess damage and coordinate structural damage, damage tolerance, and repair assessments.
Designs major and minor repairs to metallic airframe structures for specific customer aircraft and standard repairs for aircraft Structural Repair Manual.
Substantiates static and fatigue of major and minor repairs and modifications to metallic airframe structures using traditional and FE analysis methods, plus safe life and damage tolerant analysis.
Analyzes structural suitability of specific airframes for life extension.
Writes and reviews technical memos, procedure instructions, engineering reports, and analyses.
Provides interpretation of technical documentation (SRM, AMM, CMM) in support of customers and Service Centers performing analysis tasks and repairs.
Participates in regular exchange and coordinates technical issue resolution with Pilatus Aircraft OEM Engineering in Switzerland.
Executes technical activities in accordance with Pilatus policies, procedures, and work instructions.
Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned by the Director of Engineering.

education_certification.credential: BS degree in aeronautical or mechanical engineering (with a focus on structural analysis)
